radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix appears hyperemic, measuring up to 7 mm in diameter, with adjacent fat stranding. No free air or free fluid. The lung bases are clear without pleural effusion, heart normal in size, liver without focal lesion, gallbladder collapsed, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands unremarkable. Bilateral kidneys show symmetric nephrogram without hydronephrosis, small and large bowel loops normal in caliber. Scattered small mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet CT size criteria for pathologic enlargement.
